intro: Lippia floribunda, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green leaves and showy, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine. Lippia floribunda is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
